discussion.author: zsunberg
discussion.text: Just noticed this as I was dealing with some of my own package registrations - I would vote for a more descriptive name than "Run" @tkf  :)

discussion.author: tkf
discussion.text:
I chose `Run` deliberately to be used as a "prefix" of the API as in `Run.test` and `Run.script`. I think they are pretty clear about what they do.

[noblock]

discussion.author: zsunberg
discussion.text:
> I chose `Run` deliberately to be used as a "prefix" of the API as in `Run.test` and `Run.script`. I think they are pretty clear about what they do.

Yes, that is very slick :smile: But it seems like there are many other things that could be called "Run", and you could also accomplish it by having a submodule called `Run`, i.e.
```julia
import IsolatedEnvironments: Run
Run.test()
```

Anyways, this is a subjective decision, so probably the best thing is to get others to weigh in - just registering my opinion.

discussion.author: zsunberg
discussion.text:
Though naming it `Run` does have the side effect of displaying "home run" in many places on the screen :rofl: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4240491/88840413-41a4bd80-d191-11ea-95ab-35fd9f85dc88.png)

discussion.author: tkf
discussion.text:
Good to go from my end (though obviously, I guess). I've been thinking it's up to JuliaRegistries/General members to incorporate the arguments from me and @zsunberg and then decide if the name is appropriate or not. It may be worth considering potential confusion with JuliaRun by JuliaComputing also.

(In the end, I personally just want to keep using this name since updating the CI for all my packages is PITA. I also don't know how many other people are using this package at this point.)
